item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Catan
item.comment: The best game ever, Holy Graal of board games - even after hundreds of newer and "better" games played, I rate it number 2 in my games collection.

item.name: The Cave
item.comment: Really nice exploration game, with scoring mechanism that rewards different choices.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: after 1 play - it's really ameritrash game and I'm obviously not ameritrash fan

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: I think the rockets ARE broken, but somehow I still like playing this game.

item.name: Excalibur
item.comment: Really good game. Little bit old-stylish (pen & paper needed, no wooden or plastic pawns), but I really enjoy it has great bunch of ideas.

item.name: Florenza
item.comment: I've played it twice, right after the Lucca Games. It really reminds me of Caylus, but with some luck element and random factor. I've played only with 2 players and it seems it's better with more - but will probably take about 3 hours.

item.name: Forbidden Desert
item.comment: Played the near-final prototype. I love the "moving desert" mechanism.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
In the Year of the Dragon
K2
item.comment: Nice family game, with strong theme. I'm not into climbing at all, still I really like the tension during the game.

item.name: Kung Fu
item.comment: Real-time Bohnanza with no rules? I'll skip on this one.

item.name: Minotaur Lords
item.comment: Totally unbalanced game. Blue deck with 0-phase hordes in unbeatable.

item.name: Prêt-à-Porter
item.comment: after 1 play during the convention, need to play more

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Seasons
item.comment: For all Race for the Galaxy and Innovation fans - this is must-have :)

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: Really satisfying board game, the best game in my collection and it really feels like Civilization.

item.name: Yukatán
item.comment: Broken game - the best (and only) tactics is to build troops and wait for other players to attack you, If everyone knows that, it's a stalemate.
